InputParameters.Title: Input Parameters
InputParameters.SingleScenarioDescr: Use one flow rate and one mud weight.
InputParameters.MultipleScenarioDescr: Use a range of flow rates and/or mud weights.

Results.Title: Results
Results.DefaultMessage: Enter values and click Calculate to see results.

Variables.CoefficientOfDischarge: ğ¾ğ‘‘: Rated coefficient of discharge that should be obtained from the valve manufacturer. For a preliminary sizing, an effective discharge coefficient can be used as follows: = 0.65 when a pressure relief valve is installed with or without a rupture disk in combination, = 0.62 when a pressure relief valve is not installed and sizing is for a rupture disk
Variables.CapacityCorrectionFactor: ğ¾ğ‘¤: Correction factor due to back pressure. If the back pressure is atmospheric, use a value for Kw of 1.0
Variables.CombinationCorrectionFactor: ğ¾ğ‘: Combination correction factor for installations with a rupture disk upstream of the pressure relief valve, = 1.0 when a rupture disk is not installed, = 0.9 when a rupture disk is installed in combination with a pressure relief valve
Variables.ViscosityCorrectionFactor: ğ¾ğ‘£: Correction factor due to viscosity, calculated based on Reynold's number
